events.description: Silver rose more than 2% toward $80 per ounce on Monday following a previous 10% jump.
Landslide victory for Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s ruling coalition.
Talks held to ease tensions, though nuclear enrichment issues remain.
Upcoming key economic data releases for guidance on Fed policy.

facts.fact_text: Silver rose more than 2% toward $80 per ounce on Monday.

evidences.evidence_text: Silver rose more than 2% toward $80 per ounce on Monday

facts.fact_text: Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s ruling coalition won a landslide victory in Japan’s weekend elections.

evidences.evidence_text: landslide victory of Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s ruling coalition in Japan’s weekend elections

facts.fact_text: The US and Iran held talks in Oman on Friday.

evidences.evidence_text: the US and Iran held talks in Oman on Friday

facts.fact_text: Tehran maintained its refusal to halt nuclear fuel enrichment.

evidences.evidence_text: Tehran maintained its refusal to halt nuclear fuel enrichment

claims.claim_text: The election victory paves the way for expansionary fiscal policies in Japan.

evidences.evidence_text: which paves the way for her expansionary fiscal policies

claims.claim_text: Last week’s extreme swings in precious metals were caused by Chinese traders.
claims.author: Scott Bessent

evidences.evidence_text: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent attributed last week’s extreme swings in precious metals to Chinese traders

claims.claim_text: The recent top in precious metals was a speculative blowoff.
claims.author: Scott Bessent

evidences.evidence_text: describing the recent top as a speculative blowoff

claims.claim_text: Investors are awaiting jobs and inflation reports for guidance on Federal Reserve policy.

evidences.evidence_text: Investors are also awaiting key US jobs and inflation reports this week for guidance on Federal Reserve policy

evidence.evidence_text: paves the way for her expansionary fiscal policies
for guidance on Federal Reserve policy
attributed last week’s extreme swings in precious metals to Chinese traders
in an effort to ease tensions
